sailpoint.tools

Class JsonHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.JsonHelper

  • public class JsonHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class that helps to format various JSON responses.

      • success

        public static java.lang.String success()
        Return a success JSON response with no details.

      • success

        public static java.lang.String success(java.lang.Object... keyValues)
        Return a success JSON response with the given parameters turned into key/value pairs in a details map. For example, the following call:

        success("firstname", "Joe", "lastname", "Cool")

        would return this:

        { "success": true, "firstname": "Joe", "lastname": "Cool" }

        Parameters:
        keyValues - The key value pairs to include in the result.

      • success

        public static java.lang.String success(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> attrs)
        Return a success JSON response with the given details.

      • emptyObject

        public static java.lang.String emptyObject()
        Return the JSON for an empty object.
        Returns:
        JSON for an empty object

      • emptyList

        public static java.lang.String emptyList()
        Return the JSON for an empty list.

      • emptyListResult

        public static java.lang.String emptyListResult(java.lang.String countProp,
                                               java.lang.String objectsProp)
        Return the JSON for an empty list result that includes the total count and a list of objects. If either property name is null, that property is not included.

      • getObjectMapper

        public static com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper getObjectMapper()
        Get a copy of the ObjectMapper for custom usage. We always copy this for safety, so the "common" one is not modified by custom code.

      • toJson

        public static java.lang.String toJson(java.lang.Object o,
                                      JsonHelper.JsonOptions... options)
        Convert the given object to JSON. NOTE: This always does "deep" serialization on the object
        Parameters:
        o - Object to serialize
        options - Any JsonOptions needed for serialization

      • fromJson

        public static <T> T fromJson(java.lang.Class<T> objectType,

                      throws GeneralException
        Convert the JSON string to an object of the given type
        Parameters:
        objectType - Class type to deserialize into.

        Returns:
